name: The O's!! Online Trivia | MLB Teams | 10 Questions

questions.text: In 1971, four Oriole pitchers won 20 or more games: Jim Palmer (20), Mike Cuellar (20), Dave McNally (21), and who?
questions.explanation:
Pat Dobson.

	Dobson won 20 games that year, and finished with a 2.90 ERA.

questions.text: In 1991, four O's pitchers combined to no-hit the Oakland A's. Mike Flanagan, Mark Williamson, and Gregg Olson each pitched one inning. Who started the game?
questions.explanation:
Bob Milacki.

	A great feat, but just the fact that Milacki shut somebody out for six innings was shock enough for me...

questions.text: What team did Cal Ripken end his consecutive games streak against?
In 1990 Cal Ripken made three errors, setting a new single-season record for fielding average (.996) among shortstops. Ripken did not win the gold glove award that year. Who did?
questions.explanation:
Ozzie Guillen.

	Guillen made 17 errors and had a .977 fielding average. I'm no math major, but....

questions.text: Eddie Murray was the first (and may still be the only, I'm not sure) player to hit a homerun from both sides of the plate in two consecutive games. What team did he victimize?
questions.explanation:
White Sox.

	My favorite player of all-time, and a sure fire future Hall of Famer.

questions.text: Who did Sparky Anderson say would 'have the worst swing in the Hall of Fame someday'?
questions.explanation:
Cal Ripken, Jr.

	Cal is known for his many, MANY different stances throughout the years.
